direction: Use CatBoost with the following settings: iterations=750, learning_rate=0.02, depth=6. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median, drop columns with more than 50% missing values, and pass categorical features using the cat_features parameter in CatBoost. Ensure all categorical variables are cast to strings before fitting the model.
executor_guidance: Make sure to handle NaN values appropriately and cast categorical variables to strings before passing them to the CatBoost model. Avoid using get_dummies as it can lead to memory issues; instead, utilize CatBoost's cat_features parameter for handling categorical data.
memory_update: CatBoost with careful hyperparameter tuning continues to be the most promising approach for improving the score.
reasoning: The CatBoost model with specific hyperparameter tuning has shown promising results, consistently outperforming other strategies. The best score so far was achieved with CatBoost using specific settings. Given the remaining budget, it is prudent to refine the CatBoost approach further with slight variations in hyperparameters to see if we can achieve a better score. We have already explored several variations of CatBoost, so we should try one more iteration with a different set of hyperparameters.
